member.name: T:Vts.BindableObject
member.summary:
Implements the INotifyPropertyChanged interface and exposes a RaisePropertyChanged method for derived classes to raise the PropertyChange event. The event arguments created by this class are cached to prevent managed heap fragmentation.
Adapted from Josh Smith's post: http://joshsmithonwpf.wordpress.com/2007/08/29/a-base-class-which-implements-inotifypropertychanged/
Added SetProperty method to simplify set operations. Changed "RaisePropertyChanged" to "OnPropertyChanged" so as to work with INotifyPropertyChangedPlus, enabling compatibility with the DependsOn attribute and PropertyDependencyManager classes

member.name: M:Vts.BindableObject.GetPropertyChangedEventArgs(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an instance of PropertyChangedEventArgs for the specified property name.
member.param: The name of the property to create event args for.

member.name: M:Vts.BindableObject.AfterPropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Derived classes can override this method to execute logic after a property is set. The base implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:Vts.BindableObject.OnPropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to raise the PropertyChanged event, and invokes the virtual AfterPropertyChanged method, regardless of whether the event was raised or not.

member.name: E:Vts.BindableObject.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Raised when a public property of this object is set.

member.name: T:Vts.Common.Math.Convolution2D
member.summary: Class containing the 'Roll' Algorithm, Custom Integration based off Tom, et al, curtesy of Owen Yang, David Cuccia, and Bernard Choi, "Real-time blood flow imaging using the graphics processing unit," (paper in preparation)

member.name: M:Vts.Common.Math.Convolution2D.LsiRoll(System.Int32[],System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: 'Roll' Algorithm, Custom Integration based off Tom, et al, curtesy of Owen Yang Owen Yang, David Cuccia, and Bernard Choi, "Real-time blood flow imaging using the graphics processing unit," (paper in preparation)
member.param: Preallocated buffer for holding the strip sum in the row
Preallocated buffer for holding the strip sum in the column
Preallocated buffer for holding the strip sums of squared values in the row
Preallocated buffer for holding the strip sums of squared values in the row
Width of the raw speckle image. Also used for calculating the size of the preallocated buffers, the 4 buffers are width*1
Height of the raw speckle image
Size of the sliding window radius
Exposure time of the camera used to obtain the raw speckle images

member.param: radius of moving window (full window size will be 2*radius+1)

member.summary: 'Roll' Algorithm, Custom Integration based off Tom, et al, curtesy of Owen Yang. Owen Yang, David Cuccia, and Bernard Choi, "Real-time blood flow imaging using the graphics processing unit," (paper in preparation)
member.param: radius of moving window (full window size will be 2*radius+1)
member.remarks: Allocates row and column strip sums and calls the most general overload

member.summary: 'Roll' Algorithm, Custom Integration based off Tom, et al, curtesy of Owen Yang. Owen Yang, David Cuccia, and Bernard Choi, "Real-time blood flow imaging using the graphics processing unit," (paper in preparation)
member.param: radius of moving window (full window size will be 2*radius+1)
member.remarks: Allocates processed image, as well as row and column strip sums and calls the most general overload. Calling this version multiple times with large images will probably thrash the GC.

member.summary: Creates a new instance based on values from a previous instance

member.summary: Creates a new instance based on values in an array [mua, musp, g, n]

member.summary: Writes the optical properties to a string in the order Mua, Musp, G and N

member.name: P:Vts.OpticalProperties.Mua
member.summary: absorption coefficient = probability of absorption per unit distance traveled

member.name: P:Vts.OpticalProperties.Mus
member.summary: scattering coefficient = probability of having scattered per unit distance traveled
member.remarks: Warning - Setting this value also modifies Musp!

member.name: P:Vts.OpticalProperties.G
member.summary: anisotropy coefficient = cosine of an average scattering angle (where the angle is relative to the incoming and outgoing unit direction vectors)
member.remarks: Warning - Setting this value also modifies Mus!

member.name: P:Vts.OpticalProperties.N
member.summary: refractive index mismatch

member.name: P:Vts.OpticalProperties.Musp
member.summary: reduced scattering coefficient = probability of having scattered per unit distance traveled
member.remarks: Warning - Setting this value also modifies Mus! Warning - This must be defined AFTER Mus and G to deserialize correctly (or alternatively, we should use [IgnoreDataMember] either here or for Mus)

member.name: T:Vts.PropertyDependencyManager
member.summary: Class to manage dependencies of INotifyPropertyChanged objects, as suggested by Tomas Elison here: http://neilmosafi.blogspot.com/2008/07/is-inotifypropertychanged-anti-pattern.html This class builds a dependency graph the "right" way. It knows for example that if Quantity is changed, TotalPrice has asked to be informed about this. The PropertyDependencyManager listens to the PropertyChanged event for any class that is registered with it and uses the dependency graph to propagate the events the right way.

member.name: T:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients
member.summary: This class holds the coefficients of the non vanishing B-slines over a single knot span and the upper and lower limit of the knot span mapped to the non parametric space. This values are used to evaluate analitically the steady state reflectance for the real domain and for the spatial frequancy domain through the integration of the time resolved curves at the required locations. The effect of the linear mapping from the original space to the parametric space is embedded within this coefficients.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.#ctor(Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsValues,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor used to evaluate the coefficients of the non vanishing B-splines over the knot span, and to evaluate the limits of the knot span, mapped to the non parametric space.
member.param: NurbsValues class with the NURBS charachteristic values
Index of the lower limit knot

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.GetKnotSpanMidTime
member.summary: Returns the middle time of a knot span mapped to the reference space.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.GetKnotSpanDeltaT
member.summary: Returns the time span of a knot span mapped to the reference space.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.ModifyIfNotValid(System.Double)
member.summary: If the input value is NaN or Inf it changes it to zero,as defined in the recursive formula used to evaluate the B-splines coefficients.'The NURBS Book' page 51.
member.param: multypling values of the recursive formula

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.Normalize(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double)
member.summary: Adjusts the B-splines coefficients to take into account the mapping from the original space to the parametric space, dividing by the maximum value of the original space elevated to the same degree of each coefficient.
member.param: max value of the original space
member.returns: B-splines coefficients devided by the maximal value of the original space elevated to the same power of the coefficients

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.EvaluateMuliplyingValues(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsValues,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the coefficients of the B-spline recursive formula. Based on the Cox - De Boor algorithm. 'The NURBS Book' page 50.
member.param: NurbsValues class with the knots vector and degree
degree of the iteration of the recursive formula

member.name: P:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.Coefficients
member.summary: Gets or sets the coefficients of the non vanishing B-splines coefficients over a single knot span.

member.summary: Gets or sets the lower limit of the knot span,mapped to the non parametric space.

member.name: P:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.BSplinesCoefficients.UpperLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper limit of the knot span,mapped to the non parametric space.

member.name: T:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.ForwardSolverBase
member.summary: This is a base class for all forward solvers. It contains default (virtual) vectorization methods such that only the scalar solver methods must be implemented to create a new IForwardSolver-implementing class. Override these virtual methods to impose optimizations possible through vectorization.

member.name: P:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.DiffusionParameters.musTilde

member.name: T:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver
member.summary: Forward solver based on the Scaled Monte Carlo approach, proposed by Kienle and Patterson, used to evaluate the reflectance of a semi-infinite homogenous medium with g = 0.8 and n = 1.4. The reference time and space resolved reflectance, and the reference spatial frequancy and time resolved reflectance are held in a NurbsGenerator class which computes the interpolation necessary to evaluate the reflectance in the specific domain. The interpolation is based on NURBS surfaces theory. The main reference used to implement this forward solver is 'The NURBS Book' by Las Piegl and Wayne Tiller.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.#ctor(Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.INurbs,Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.INurbs)
member.summary: Constructor which creates an istance of NurbsForwardSolver setting the NurbsGenerators to the values passed as Input.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.#ctor
member.summary: Default class constructor called by solver factory.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.#ctor(Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.INurbs)
member.summary: Constructor used to create an istance of NurbsForwardSolver with the same stub NurbsGenerator for all the NurbsGenerators. Used for Unit Tests of the class.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfRho(Vts.OpticalProperties,System.Double)
member.summary: Calls its vectorized version to evaluate the steady state reflectance at a source detector separation rho, for the specified optical properties.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfRho(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Vts.OpticalProperties},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Returns the steady state reflectance for the specified optical properties at source detector separations rhos. The radial distance rho is scaled to the reference space to evaluate rho_ref. If rho_ref is on the reference surface the reference rho-time resolved reflectance is scaled and the isoprametric Nurbs curve is integrated analitically over time. To evaluate the integral of the reflectance out of the time range it evaluates the linear approximation of the logarithm of the tail of the curve and integrates it from tMax to infinity. If rho_ref is out of range the method returns 0.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfRhoAndTime(Vts.OpticalProperties,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calls its vectorized version to evaluate the time and space resolved reflectance at a source detector separation rho and at time t, for the specified optical properties.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfRhoAndTime(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Vts.OpticalProperties},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Returns the reflectance at radial distance rho and time t scaling the reference rho-time resolved reflectance. The returned value is forced to zero if the time t is smaller then the minimal time of flight required to reach a detector at a distance rho. If a point of the reference reflectance outside the time range of the surface is required, the value is extrapolated using the linear approximation of the logarithm of R for two points placed at the end of the time range [Tmax - 0.1ns, Tmax]. If the required point is outside the radial range a linear extarpolation is used, based on the value of R at [0.95*RhoMax, RhoMax]. If the required point is outside both ranges a linear combination of the two extrapolations is adopted.
member.returns: space and time resolved reflectance at rho and t

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfRhoAndFt(Vts.OpticalProperties,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calls its vectorized version to evaluate the temporal frequency and space resolved reflectance at a source detector separation rho for a modulation frequency ft, for the specified optical properties.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfRhoAndFt(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Vts.OpticalProperties},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Evaluates the temporal frequency and space resolved reflectance at a source detector separation rho for a modulation frequency ft,for the specified optical properties. It calculates the Fourier transform of the NURBS curve R(t) at the required source detector separation. The used FT is analitycal or discrete according to the boolean value 'analyticIntegration'.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfFx(Vts.OpticalProperties,System.Double)
member.summary: Calls its vectorized version to evaluate the spatial frequency resolved reflectance for the spatial frequancy fx, for the specified optical properties.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfFx(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Vts.OpticalProperties},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Returns the spatial frequancy resolved reflectance at fx applying the scaling on the reference fx-time resolved reflectance. Than integrates analitically the isoprametric NURBS curve over time if fx is on the surface. If fx is out of range it returns 0.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfFxAndTime(Vts.OpticalProperties,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calls its vectorized version to evaluate the time and space resolved reflectance for a spatial frequancy, fx, and at time, t, for the specified optical properties.
member.returns: spatial frequency and time resolved reflectance

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfFxAndTime(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Vts.OpticalProperties},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Returns the reflectance at spatial frequency, fx, and time, t, scaling the reference fx-time resolved reflectance. If a point of the reference reflectance outside the time/spatial frequancy range of the surface is required, the value is extrapolated using the first derivative along the time/spatial frequency dimension. If the required point is outside both ranges a linear combination of the two derivatives is used.
member.returns: spatial frequency and time resolved reflectance

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfFxAndFt(Vts.OpticalProperties,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calls its vectorized overload to evaluate the spatial frequency and temporal frequency resolved reflectance.
member.returns: spatial frequency and temporal frequancy resolved reflectance

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.ROfFxAndFt(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Vts.OpticalProperties},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Evaluates the spatial frequency and temporal frequency resolved reflectance calculating the Fourier transform of the NURBS curve R(t) at the required spatial frequency for the specified optical properties. The computed FT is analitycal or discrete according to the boolean value 'analyticIntegration'.
member.returns: spatial frequency and temporal frequancy resolved reflectance

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsForwardSolver.CheckIfValidOutput(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns zero if the input value is smaller then zero of if it is NaN. Negative value are not possible for the measured reflectance. The values calculated with the NURBS could be negative when the time point is very close to the 'physical' beginning of the curve R(t) due to obscilatoions of the interpolations used to capture the ascent of the curve.

member.summary: Extrapolates the linear decay of the log of the tail of the curve and integrates analitically from tMax to infinity to evaluate the steady state signal

parametric point mapped in the interval 0-1

member.summary: Calculate the value of a point on a NURBS surface.

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsGenerator.FindSpan(Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsValues,System.Double)
member.summary: Searches for the knot span where the parametric point lies, with a classic binary search.If the point is larger then the last knot element returns the last span index to evaluate the value of a point on the edge of the surface, which is later used for derivative extrapolation. Adapted from algorithm 2.1 from 'The NURBS Book' page 68.
member.param: NurbsValues class which contains the knot,degree and control points
member.returns: knot span where the parametric point belongs
member.exception: Thrown when the input parametric point is negative

member.summary: Multiplies each polynomial coefficient with its corresponding control point. 'The NURBS Book' page 81.
member.param: control point of the isoparamentric Nurbs curve
member.returns: polynomial coefficients multiplied by the respective control point

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsGenerator.EvaluateKnotSpanIntegralValue(System.Double,System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the integral of a NURBS curve over a single knotspan. If the integral has to be performed to evaluate ROfRho the algorithm checks if the lower time limit of the knot span is larger then the minimum time of flight necessary to reach the detector. The integration is analytical only for the real domain and only if the time span is larger then a threshold value and only if the value of the exponential decay due to absorption is larger then a threshold value.
member.param: polynomial coefficients of the non null B-splines curves over the knot span
tensor product control points of the isoparametric curve
knot span lower limit mapped to the physical value of the parametrized variable
knot span upper limit mapped to the physical value of the parametrized variable
spatial coordiante mapped to the refernce space
member.returns: integral value of a NURBS curve over a single knotspan

member.name: M:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.NurbsGenerator.IntegrateExponentialMultipliedByPolynomial(System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates for each term of the polynomial the integral value of its multiplication with the exponential decay within the lower and upper limit.
member.returns: integral of the polynomial multiplied by an exponential over the specified range

member.name: T:Vts.Modeling.ForwardSolvers.TwoLayerSDAForwardSolver
member.summary: This implements Kienle's two-layer SDA solutions described in: 1) Kienle et al., "Noninvasive determination of the optical properties of two-layered turbid media", Applied Optics 37(4), 1998. 2) Kienle et al., "In vivo determination of the optical properties of muscle with time- resolved reflectance using a layered model, Phys. Med. Biol. 44, 1999 (in particular, the appendix) Notes: 1) this solution assumes that the embedded source is within top layer. 2) zp = location of embedded isotropic source is determined using layer 1 opt. props. 3) zb = extrapolated boundary is determined using layer 1 opt. props. This currently inherits ForwardSolverBase. In order to provide fluence of ft type solutions, this would need to inherit DiffusionForwardSolverBase however the methods there assume homogeneous tissue so not sure best way to implement ft type solutions.

member.name: T:Vts.Modeling.HankelTransform
member.summary: Evaluate the Hankel transform using a digital fitler method for the quadrature points. Necessary to have a continuous function for transformation.

member.name: F:Vts.Modeling.HankelTransform.dataLength
member.summary: Zero order Hankel Transform of Anayltic expression by digital filtering. Based on a Matlab code by Prof. Brian Borcher which is based on a Fortran program by Walt Anderson which was published as Anderson, W.L., 1979, Computer Program Numerical Integration of Related Hankel Transforms of Orders 0 and 1 by Adaptive Digital Filtering. Geophysic, 44(7):1287-1305. Actual weights used in this code are from a later updated version of the code
member.returns: IEnumerable corresponding to points being transformed

member.name: T:Vts.MonteCarlo.Detectors.ReflectedDynamicMTOfRhoAndSubregionHistDetectorInput
member.summary: Tally for Reflected dynamic MT as a function of Rho using blood volume fraction in each tissue region. This detector also tallies the total and dynamic MT as a function of Z. If a random number is less than blood volume fraction for the tissue region in which the collision occurred, then hit blood and considered "dynamic" event. Otherwise, it is a "static" event. This works for Analog and DAW processing.

member.name: T:Vts.MonteCarlo.Detectors.ReflectedDynamicMTOfXAndYAndSubregionHistDetectorInput
member.summary: Tally for Reflected dynamic MT as a function of X and Y using blood volume fraction in each tissue region. This detector also tallies the total and dynamic MT as a function of Z. If a random number is less than blood volume fraction for the tissue region in which the collision occurred, then hit blood and considered "dynamic" event. Otherwise, it is a "static" event. This works for Analog and DAW processing.

member.name: T:Vts.MonteCarlo.Detectors.TransmittedDynamicMTOfRhoAndSubregionHistDetectorInput
member.summary: Tally for Transmitted dynamic MT as a function of Rho using blood volume fraction in each tissue region. This detector also tallies the total and dynamic MT as a function of Z. If a random number is less than blood volume fraction for the tissue region in which the collision occurred, then hit blood and considered "dynamic" event. Otherwise, it is a "static" event. This works for Analog and DAW processing.

member.name: T:Vts.MonteCarlo.Detectors.TransmittedDynamicMTOfXAndYAndSubregionHistDetectorInput
member.summary: Tally for Transmited dynamic MT as a function of X and Y using blood volume fraction in each tissue region. This detector also tallies the total and dynamic MT as a function of Z. If a random number is less than blood volume fraction for the tissue region in which the collision occurred, then hit blood and considered "dynamic" event. Otherwise, it is a "static" event. This works for Analog and DAW processing.

member.name: T:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType
member.summary: PhotonStateType is a bitmap of Photon.StateFlag. Combinations of bits indicate the current state of the photon. These states communicate what to do with the photon. ref: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/37921/Enums-Flags-and-Csharp-Oh-my-bad-pun.aspx or http://stackoverflow.com/questions/93744/most-common-c-bitwise-operations

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.None
member.summary: no bits set

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.Alive
member.summary: photon alive

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.ExitedDomain
member.summary: photon exited domain

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.Absorbed
member.summary: photon was absorbed, used only in analog random walk process

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.KilledOverMaximumPathLength
member.summary: photon killed because path length too long

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.KilledOverMaximumCollisions
member.summary: photon killed because number of collisions over maximum

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.KilledRussianRoulette
member.summary: photon killed by Russian Roulette

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.PseudoReflectedTissueBoundary
member.summary: photon pseudo-collision at reflected tissue boundary

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.PseudoTransmittedTissueBoundary
member.summary: photon pseudo-collision at transmitted tissue boundary

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.PhotonStateType.PseudoSpecularTissueBoundary
member.summary: photon pseudo-collision at specular tissue boundary

member.summary: photon pseudo-collision at DiffuseReflectance Virtual Boundary (VB)

member.name: T:Vts.MonteCarlo.VirtualBoundaryType
member.summary: Virtual boundaries are entities upon which detectors are attached. Each detector is associated with one and only one of the following types. The VBs have a spatial location (surface or volume) and sometimes have a direction.

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.VirtualBoundaryType.DiffuseReflectance
member.summary: All diffuse reflectance detectors attach to this virtual boundary type

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.VirtualBoundaryType.DiffuseTransmittance
member.summary: All diffuse transmittance detectors attach to this virtual boundary type

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.VirtualBoundaryType.SpecularReflectance
member.summary: Specular reflection detectors attach to this virtual boundary type

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.VirtualBoundaryType.GenericVolumeBoundary
member.summary: Internal volume detectors attach to this virtual boundary type

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.VirtualBoundaryType.SurfaceRadiance
member.summary: Internal surface detectors attach to this virtual boundary type

member.name: F:Vts.MonteCarlo.VirtualBoundaryType.pMCDiffuseReflectance
member.summary: Virtual boundary used for pMC diffuse reflectance detectors

member.name: T:Vts.MonteCarlo.DatabaseType

member.name: T:Vts.MonteCarlo.Helpers.DetectorBinning
member.summary: Methods that aid in determining which detector bin to tally.

member.name: M:Vts.MonteCarlo.Helpers.DetectorBinning.WhichBin(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: WhichBin determines which uniform bin "value" is in. If data is beyond last bin, the last bin is returned. If the data is smaller than first bin, the first bin is returned. This assumes bins are contiguous.

member.name: M:Vts.MonteCarlo.Helpers.DetectorBinning.WhichBinExclusive(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: WhichBin determines which uniform bin "value" is in. If data is beyond last bin, it is not binned and -1 is returned If the data is smaller than first bin, it is not binned and -1 is returned This assumes bins are contiguous.

member.name: M:Vts.MonteCarlo.Helpers.DetectorBinning.WhichBin(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: WhichBin determines which bin "value" is in given a list of bin centers and bin sizes. If value not in any bin, -1 returned. This allows for non-contiguous bins and nonuniformly spaced bins.

member.name: M:Vts.MonteCarlo.Helpers.DetectorBinning.WhichBin(System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: WhichBin determines which bin "value" is in given a list of bin stops. If value not in any bin, -1 returned. This allows for nonuniformly spaced bins within assumed contiguous span starting from 0.

member.name: M:Vts.MonteCarlo.Helpers.DetectorBinning.GetTimeDelay(System.Double,System.Double)

member.param: refractive index of medium where pathlength is determined

member.summary: Method to determine rho given x and y coordinates
